title: Paloma Faith shows off her quirky sense at the Global Gift Gala
text:
She's set to perform at the annual event and receive the Empowerment Award.

And Paloma Faith showed off her signature quirky sense of style at the Global Gift Gala held at the Kimpton Fitzroy London Hotel on Thursday.

The Crybaby hitmaker, 38, turned heads in a red metallic dress with a corset top and flowing skirt, it also had flared sleeves.

Work it: Paloma Faith showed off her signature quirky sense of style at the Global Gift Gala held at the Kimpton Fitzroy London Hotel on Thursday

Sticking to the colour theme, Paloma accessorised her look with a pair of matching ankle heeled boots.

The singer put on a giddy display as she giggled on the red carpet and posed up a storm in her ensemble.

Paloma styled her blonde locks into a blow-dried hairdo which she sweptback with a collection of red slides.

She added a slick of minimal make-up which enhanced her stunning features, which included lashings of mascara and a pink lipstick.

Gorgeous: The Crybaby hitmaker, 38, turned heads in a red metallic dress with a corset top and flowing skirt, it also had flared sleeves

Proceeds from The Global Gift Gala go to The Global Gift Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organisation that aims to create a positive impact on the lives of children, women and families around the world.

The event, which will be hosted by David Walliams, will see Simon Cowell handed the Philanthropist Award, while Paloma Faith – who will also perform – will receive the Empowerment Award, among others.

Only recently, Paloma revealed the reason why she keeps her child's name and gender a secret in a new candid interview.

The singer, 38, explained that she keeps the gender hidden as she doesn't know 'who they're going to become'.

Details: Sticking to the colour theme, Paloma accessorised her look with a pair of matching ankle heeled boots

Work it: The singer put on a giddy display as she giggled and posed up a storm in her ensemble

Glamorous: Paloma styled her blonde locks into a blow-dried hairdo which she sweptback with a collection of red slides

The chat also saw Paloma tragically reveal that she's had two miscarriages since welcoming her child.

The Picking Up The Pieces hitmaker has often raised eyebrows with her and partner Leyman Lahcine's decision not to reveal her two-year-old tot's gender or name to the public.

But, speaking to The Sunday Times magazine, she shared the exact reason why she made the choice and it's all to do with her child's future.

Strike a pose: Maria Bravo, Melanie Griffith, Paloma and Eva Longoria all posed for a photo together at the star-studded gala

She said: 'It's just because I don't want information about [my child] out there, because I don't know who they're going to become. If they want to be in the public eye when they get older, then that's their choice.'

The star stated that she doesn't feel that gender is 'important' and adds that society puts too much significance to a child's gender which leads to children becoming 'indoctrinated'.

Paloma went on to share that her child plays with unisex toys and what ever they grew up to be, whether gay or transgender for example, she would 'embrace it'.
